info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 14 at 10:37PM MDT by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Granite and southeastern Powell Counties through 1115 PM MDT... At 1036 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles west of Garrison, or 12 miles northwest of Deer Lodge, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Deer Lodge, Garrison, Jens, Princeton, Brock Creek, Goldcreek and Avon. This includes the following highways... Interstate 90 between mile markers 157 and 178. Highway 12 Garrison to MacDonald Pass between mile markers 0 and 12. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
